page.title: 19Population Change
page.content: We know from the original{Domesday {Book of 1086}that 22 families then lived in what was known as{Wivelingham (the present day Willingham). By 1251 the Ely Coucher Book shows that this had grown to 75 families - say{300 people. By the mid 16th Century the population of Willingham had risen to 500 or so. At the time of the{Civil War}the figure of{600}was reached. It was in the early 1800's that the village population began to grow rapidly and passed the{1600}mark. The advent of the railway led to a further population increase as the ability to move the area's agricultural produce stepped up trade. {By 1960}more than{1750 people}lived in Willingham and since then has followed the most rapid growth to the present day figure of{over 2700.
